p: The reverse-transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) technique has been used to detect BVDV-infected cattle among dairy herds. This testing technique for bulk tank milk is useful as a screening test to detect any PI cattle among lactating cows [ 19]. It is a cost-effective diagnostic method. The virus has been detected by RT-PCR when milk from a PI animal was diluted to 1:600 with milk from a BVDV-free herd [ 28].
